column4: Who am I? You sure you want to know?
The story of my life is not for the faint of heart.
If somebody said it was a happy little tale...
...if somebody told you I was just an average guy, not a care in the world...
But let me assure you, this, like any story worth telling...
That girl. The girl next door. Mary Jane Watson.
The woman I've loved since before I liked girls.
I'd like to tell you that's me next to her.
Aw, heck, I'd even take him.
Stop! He's been chasing us since Woodhaven Boulevard.
Thank you. I'm sorry I'm late.
No wandering. Proceed direct... Knock it off.
Remember, it is a privilege to be here.
We are guests of Columbia University's Science Department.
Let's not have a repeat of our trip to the planetarium.
Come on people, let's stay together.
Proceed up the steps and into the building.
You know Charles, can you drive around the corner please?
Dad, these are the public school kids. I'm not showing up to a field trip, in a Rolls.
What? You want me to trade my car in for a Jetta...
...just because you flunked out every of private school I ever sent you to?
Don't ever be ashamed of who you are.
I'm not ashamed of who I am.
Harry! Won't you be needing this?
Peter, may I introduce my father, Norman Osborn.
I've heard so much about you.
It's a great honor to meet you sir.
Harry tells me you're quite the science whiz.You know, I'm something of a scientist myself.
I read all your research on nanotechnology. Really brilliant.
Yes, I wrote a paper on it.
Impressive. Your parents must be very proud.
Well, I live with my aunt and uncle. They are proud.
I think he wants to adopt you.
There are over 32,000 known species of spider in the world.
They're in the order Araneae, which is divided into three suborders.
This is the most advanced electron microscope on the Eastern seaboard.
Arachnids from all three groups possess...
...varying strengths which help them in their constant search for food.
For example, the Delena spider, family Sparassidae...
...has the ability to jump to catch its prey.
Next, we have the Net Web spider, family Filistatidae...
It spins an intricate funnel-shaped web whose strands have a tensile strength...
...proportionately equal to the type of high-tension wires used in bridge building.
Or his father will fire your father.
What's Daddy gonna do? Sue me?
The next person who talks will fail this course. I kid you not.
...hunts using a set of reflexes with nerve-conduction velocity so fast...
...that some researchers believe it almost borders on precognition.
Some spiders change colors to blend into their environment.
Peter, what makes you think I would want to know that?
Over five painstaking years, Columbia's genetic research facility...
You gonna talk to her now?
Oh, no. Come on. You talk to her.
Armed with these DNA blueprints, we have now begun what was once thought impossible.
You know, spiders can change their color...
transfer RNA to encode an entirely new genome...
...combining the genetic information from all three spiders...
Huh..I guess the researchers are working on that one.
Do you know that this is the largest electron microscope on the Eastern seaboard?
You were talking throughout that woman's entire presentation.
Let's go talk about how we listen.
I don't know what it's like at those fancy private schools Oswald...
Hey..Uh..Could I take your picture? I need one with a student in it.
Where do you want me? Over here?
We've solved the horizon glide and the multi-G balance issues.
That's not what I'm here for.
General Slocum, good to see you again.
Always a pleasure to have our board of directors pay us a little visit.
I want the progress report on human performance enhancers.
We tried vapor inhalation with rodent subjects. They showed an 800% increase in strength.
All the tests since then, have been successful.
And in the trial that went wrong, what happened? What were the side effects?
With the exception of Dr. Stromm, our entire staff certifies the product...
We need to take the whole line back to formula.
I'm going to be frank with you.
I never supported your program. We have my predecessor to thank for that.
Norman, The General gave the go ahead to Quest Aerospace...
...to build a prototype of their exoskeleton design.
And if your so-called performance enhancers..
...have not had a successful human trial by that date...
...I'm going to pull your funding. I'm going to give it to them.
And the Lord said, "Let there be light." And voilà! There is light.
Forty soft, glowing watts of it.
Good boy. God will be thrilled. Just don't fall on your ass.
I'm already on my ass, May.
When the plant's senior electrician is laid off after 35 years...
...what would you call it? I am on my ass.
Hand me that dish. The green one.
The corporation is downsizing the people...
Oh, Ben, you'll get another job somewhere.
Well, let's look in the paper and see.
There are the want ads. What do we got here?
Computer salesman, computer engineer, computer analyst.
My Lord, even the computers need analysts these days.
May..I'm 68 years old. I'm too old for computers, and besides, I have a family to provide for.
I love you. And Peter loves you.
You're the most responsible man I've ever known.
We've been down-and-out before. But somehow, we survive.
Hi, sweetie. You're just... Just in time for dinner.
Hey! How you doing buddy? How was the field trip?
I don't feel well. I'm gonna go to sleep.
Well di.did..did you get some pictures, Peter?
...we use synthesized transfer RNA to encode an entirely new genome...
...combining the genetic information from all three spiders...
Dr. Osborn, please. The performance enhancers aren't ready.
The data just doesn't justify this test.
Now, I'm asking you for the last time. We can't do this.
Risks are part of laboratory science.
Let me reschedule, with proper medical staff and a volunteer.
If you just give me two weeks..
In two weeks? We'll have lost the contract to Quest and OSCORP will be dead.
Sometimes you gotta do things yourself.
It begins catalyzation when the vapor hits the bloodstream.
40,000 years of evolution......and we've barely even tapped the vastness of human potential.
Any better this morning? Any change?
Well, hurry up. You're going to be late.
Jeez. I thought you were sick.
You haven't eaten anything, have you got your lunch money?
Hey Michaelangelo, don't forget we're painting the kitchen right after school. Got it?
Sure, Uncle Ben. Don't start without me.
And don't start up with me.
Teenagers. Raging hormones. They never change.
You're trash! You're always gonna be trash just like her!
I have to go to school.
I don't know if you realize this, but we've been neighbors since I was 6.
And I was wondering if we could get together sometime?
I got the car. Hop in.
Do something fun? Or, I don't know.
I thought it'd be time to get to know each other.
Sorry, Parker, the bus is full!
What are you doing on the floor?
Have you been there all night?
Sir, I asked her to wait in the foyer.
Mr. Osborn, Dr. Stromm is dead.
They found his body in the lab. He's been murdered, sir.
And the flight suit and the glider...
Hey, you have blue eyes. I didn't notice without your glasses.
Think you're funny don't you, freak?
My fist breaking your teeth is the accident.
I don't want to fight you Flash.
I wouldn't want to fight me neither.
Jesus, Parker, you are a freak.
I'm out of here. Come on.
Is she back with the beer yet?
You're as stupid as your mother.
Where's she going? Where you going?
The dishes aren't done. Somebody's gotta do dishes.
Get in here and do the dishes.
You do them. They're yours, anyway.
Well, I heard, but I was just taking out the trash.
I guess you can always hear us.
Oh, they can scream pretty good sometimes.
Listen, M.J., about today at school with Flash...
He's just happy you didn't give him a black eye for graduation.
So where are you going after you graduate?
I wanna move into the city.
And hopefully, get a job as a photographer.
Can't wait to get out of here.
You were awesome in all the school plays.
I cried like a baby when you played Cinderella.
You can just see what's coming.
What do you see coming for you?
Whatever it is, it's something I never felt before.
Hey, M.J.! Come take a ride in my new birthday present.
Oh, my God. What a cool car!
Wait till you hear the sound system. Hey, don't scratch the leather.
I'm exercising. I'm not dressed, Aunt May.
Well, you're acting so strangely, Peter.
Something's bothering him. Maybe he's too embarrassed to tell me what it is.
Maybe I'm too embarrassed to ask him.
I don't know, I just don't know anymore.
I'm going to the downtown library. I'll see you later.
Wait. I'll drive you there, buddy.
No, I need the exercise. Go on. Go, go, go.
Thanks for the ride, Uncle Ben.
Now wait a minute. We need to talk.
Well, we can talk now. If you let me.
What do we have to talk about? Why now?
Because we haven't talked for so long. your Aunt May and I don't even know who you are anymore.
You shirk your chores. You have all those weird experiments in your room.
I didn't start that fight, I told you that.
Well you sure as hell finished it.
What was I supposed to do, run away?
No, you're not supposed to run away, but...
Pete look, you're changing. I know. I went through exactly the same thing at your age.
Peter..these are the years when a man changes...
...into the man he's gonna become the rest of his life.
Just be careful who you change into.
This guy, Flash Thompson, he probably deserved what happened.
But just because you can beat him up...
Remember, with great power comes great responsibility.
Are you afraid that I'm going to turn into some kind of criminal? Quit worrying about me, okay?
Something's different. I'll figure it out. Stop lecturing, please.
I don't mean to lecture and I don't mean to preach. And I know I'm not your father..
I'll pick you up here at 10.
Bone Saw! Bone Saw! Bone Saw!
...give it up for Bone Saw McGraw.
...is there no one here man enough to stay in the ring...
...for three minutes with this titan of testosterone?
There's no featherweight division here small fry. Next.
Okay. You understand the NYWL is not responsible...
...for any injury you may and probably will sustain while participating in said event
And you are indeed participating of your own free will?
Down the hall to the ramp. May God be with you. Next.
Will the next victim please enter the arena at this time?
If he can withstand just three minutes in the cage with Bone Saw McGraw...
...the sum of $3000 will be paid to...
The Human Spider? That's it? That's the best you got?
The sum of $3000 will be paid to...
I don't care, Get out there.
No, he got my name wrong.
Bone Saw will eat you up and spit you out, little man.
I hope you brought your mommy.
You'll need someone to cry to.
I'm gonna rip all eight of your feeble legs off one by one.
Oh, God. I can't feel my legs.
Will the guards please lock the cage doors at this time?
Hey listen! This is some kind of mistake. I didn't sign up for a cage match!
Unlock the thing! Take the chain off!
I got you for three minutes.
What are you doing up there?
Staying away from you.That's a cute outfit. Did your husband give it to you?
Ladies and gentlemen, give it up for the new champion, Spider-Man!
A hundred bucks? The ad said 3000.
It said three grand for three minutes. You pinned him in two.
For that, I give you 100. You're lucky to get that.
I missed the part where that's my problem.
Put the money in the bag.
Stop him! He's got my money!
What's wrong with you? You let him go!
Cut him off and call the cops!
You could've taken that guy apart. Now he'll get away with my money.
I missed the part where that's my problem.
Come on, folks. Keep moving, please. Keep moving. Let's go!
Excuse me. Excuse me. Excuse me.
We just called the paramedics. They're on their way.
They got the shooter. He's headed south on Fifth.
We got three cars in pursuit. All right, folks. Come on, move back.
Get a unit to the rear!
Don't hurt me. Give me a chance. Give me a chance!
What about my uncle? Did you give him a chance? Did you?Answer me!
Freeze! We've got the place completely surrounded.
Oh, no. Oh, my God. No!
Our exoskeleton's got real firepower, General Slocumm.
Well, if it does what you say it can, I'll sign that contract tomorrow.
I assume you're confident about this test?
Absolutely. Captain Curtis is our top pilot.
Now, what about your commitment to OSCORP?
Nothing would please me more than to put Norman Osborn out of business.
We are picking up an unidentified object closing fast.
Darling, I'm so proud of you. You looked so handsome up there.
Pete. Good news. My Father got the place in New York so we're all set this Friday.
It's not the first time I've been proven wrong.
Peter, the science award. That's terrific.
I know this has been a difficult time for you......but I want you to try to enjoy this day.
The end of one thing, the start of something new.
I don't want to be with you anymore. Here's your ring.
You're like a brother to Harry. That makes you family.
And if you ever need anything, give me a call.
I missed him a lot today.
I can't help thinking about the last thing I said to him.
He tried to tell me something important, and I threw it in his face.
He never doubted the man you'd grow into.
How you were meant for great things.
With great power comes great responsibility.
This is not a man. My brother saw him building a nest in the Lincoln Center fountain.
They think he's human. They think he's a man. Could be a woman.
Bobby. Get a load of this!
He throws up his hands, ropes come out, and he climbs up them like a spider web.
I see the web, his signature, and I know Spider-Man was here.
The guy protects us, you know protects the people.
Some kind of freakyloo or something. Wakadoo
He stinks and I don't like him.
Guy with eight hands. Sounds hot.
Those tights and that tight little...
Dresses like a spider He looks like a bug
But we should all just give him One big hug
Look out Here comes the Spider-Man
"Who is Spider-Man?" He's a criminal, that's who he is.
A vigilante, a public menace. Why's he on my front page?
Mr. Jameson, your wife is on the line... she needs to know if--
Mr Jameson, there's a page six problem.
We have a page one problem, shut up.
These are really important clients they can't wait.
He pulled six people off a subway car.
Sure from a wreck he probably caused.
Something goes wrong and this creepy-crawler is there. Look at that! He's fleeing the scene. What's that tell you?
He's not fleeing, he's probably going to save somebody else. He's a hero!
Then why the mask hrmm? What's he got to hide?
She needs to know if you want chintz or chenille in the dining room.
We double-booked page six. See so both Macy's and Conway's have three-quarters of the same page.
Tomorrow morning. Spiderman. Page one with a decent picture this time. Move Conway to page seven.
Make it page eight and give 'em 10 percent off. No make it 5 percent.
Problem is we don't have a decent picture. Eddie's been on it for weeks, we can barely get a glimpse of him.
We can get a picture of Julia Roberts in a thong we can certainly get a picture of this weirdo.
Put an ad on the front page. "Cash money for a picture of Spiderman"
He doesn't want to be famous? I'll make him infamous!
What are you doing around here?
I'm begging for a job. How about you?
An audition? So you're acting now?
I work steady. In fact, I just got off a job.
You're doing it. Your living your dream.
Next time that happens, I'm gonna take it outta your cheque!
Excuse me, Miss Watson? I'm talking to you! Hey!
Yes, Enrique! Okay? I get you.
Well it better not happen no more. Don't roll your eyes at me.
That's nothing to be embarrassed about.
Aren't you guys live together? We're going out. Didn't he tell you?
I..I..I think he'd hate the idea of my waiting tables.
He'd think it was low or something.
That's not low. You have a job.
You know, Harry doesn't live on a little place I like to call Earth.
Let's get some lunch some evening.
Uhh..well..I'll come by someday and have some of your Moondance coffee some day.
Five new contracts. It'll be great. Hahaha
Stormin Norman's making his weekly inspection.
Spent half of it on the phone.
Look, I am glad you're here. I need your help. I'm really lost here.
You look like you just got second place in the science fair.
No..I uhh..I was late for work and Dr. Connors fired me.
I don't get it. Where do you go all the time?
Maybe you'll tell me who she is.
This mystery girl Harry's been dating.
When do I get to meet her?
Well, sorry. Harry hasn't mentioned her.
Hey Pete, you're probably looking for a job now, right?
Um Dad, maybe you can help him out.
No, I appreciate it, but I'll be fine.
It's no problem. I'll make a few calls.
No, I couldn't accept it sir. I like to earn what I get. I can find my own work.
You want to make it on your own steam.
What other skills do you have Parker?
I was thinking of something in photography.
I'll give you $200 bucks for all of them.
Sir your wife said that tile you want in the foyer is out of stock.
Tell her we'll just put a rug there.
I'll give you 300. That's the standard freelance fee.
Tear up page one. Run that photo instead.
"Spider-Man, Hero or Menace? Exclusive Daily Bugle Photos."
Menace? He was protecting that armor--
Tell you what Atticus, you take the pictures
...I'll make up the headlines, ok? all right? That ok with you?
Give this to the girl up front. She'll see you get paid.
Best thing in the world for a kid your age.
Bring me some more shots of that newspaper selling clown, maybe I'll take 'em off your hands.
But I never said you have a job. Meat.
I'll send you a box of Christmas meat. Best I can do. Get outta here. Bring me more photos.
Mr. Jameson told me to give that to you.
...as the principal supplier to the United States military.
In short, ladies and gentlemen of the board...
...and our stock has never been higher.
Wonderful news, Norman. Wonderful In fact, it's the reason we're selling the company.
Yes, Quest Aerospace is recapitalizing in the wake of the bombing. Expanding.
They made a tender offer we can't ignore.
The last thing they want is a power struggle with entrenched management.
The deal is off if you come with it.
The board expects your resignation in 30 days.
You can't do this to me.
You know how much I sacrificed?!
We're announcing the sale after the World Unity Festival.
Welcome to OSCORP Industry's Unity Day Festival! Let's hear it for Macy Gray.
M.J., why didn't you wear the black dress?
Just, I wanted to impress my father. He loves black.
Well, maybe he'll be impressed no matter what. You think I'm pretty.
M.J, would you do me a favor? I forgot my drink inside. Come on..
Have you seen my father around?
Well, I'm not sure..if he's coming today.
We'll meet again, Spider-Man!Well, beats taking the subway.
Don't mind us. She just needs to use the elevator.
Incredible? What do you mean he's incredible?
No. All right, wait. Stay there. Im gona come over.
All right. Fine. Will you call me in the morning?
And we'll go and have breakfast and...
...um I want to buy you something.
Because I want to. It'll make you feel better.
Okay..And what do you mean, incredible?
All right. I'm sorry. Sleep tight.
She's all right. She's..just a little rattled.
Look, Peter, I should have told you about us.
But you should know I'm crazy about her.
It's just, you know, you never made a move.
I'm gonna stay up for a while.
Whatever it is, somebody has to stop it.
Don't play the innocent with me.
Follow the cold shiver running down your spine.
Did you think it was coincidence?
So many good things, all happening for you.
To remove those in your way.
Your little accident in the laboratory.
Bringing you what you've always wanted
There's only one who can stop us.
Or imagine if he joined us..hahaha..
The Green Goblin. You like that? Made it up myself.
These weirdos all gotta have a name now.
Call the patent office, copyright the name Green Goblin, I want a quarter every time somebody says it.
Spiderman wasn't attacking the city he was trying to save it. That's slander.
It is not. I resent that.
Slander is spoken. In print, it's libel.
You don't trust anybody, that's your problem.
What are you his lawyer? Get out of here!
Let him sue me. Get rich like a normal person. That's what made this country...
Who's the photographer who takes the pictures of Spiderman?
I don't know who he is. His stuff comes in the mail.
He's the one who can bring me to him.
I don't know who he is.
Spiderman! I knew you two were in this together.
Hey, kiddo, let Mom and Dad talk for a minute, will ya.
Wake up, little spider. Wake up.
You and I are not so different.
I'm not like you. You're a murderer.
I chose my path, you chose the way of the hero.
And they found you amusing for a while, the people of this city.
But the one thing they love more than a hero...
...is to see a hero fail, fall, die trying.In spite of everything you've done for them, eventually, they will hate you.
There are eight million people in this city.
And those teeming masses exist for the sole purpose...
...of lifting the few exceptional people onto their shoulders.
I could squash you like a bug right now.
But I'm offering you a choice. Join me.
Imagine what we could accomplish together.
Cause the deaths of countless innocents in selfish battle...
...again and again and again until we're both dead. Is that what you want?
In spite of everything you've done for them, eventually, they will hate you.
I was in the neighborhood. Needed to see a friendly face.
I took two buses and a cab to get in the neighborhood, but...
Well..They said I needed acting lessons.
A soap opera told me I needed acting lessons.
Let me buy you a cheeseburger. The sky's the limit, up to $7.84.
Oh, but I'm going out to dinner with Harry.
No thanks. How's it going with?
Never mind. That's none of my business.
Sorry you won't come with us.
Hey, where you going, baby? Come on!
You have a knack for getting in trouble.
You have a knack for saving my life. I think I have a superhero stalker.
Do I get to say thank you this time?
I have to get in there!! My baby's in there!! My baby's in there!!
I can't let you in there! The roof's about to collapse!
God bless you, Spider-Man. Bless you.
There he is! Don't let him get away!Hold it! Hold it right there! You're under arrest. I'm taking you in.
Oh, my God, there's somebody still up there!
I'll be here when you get back.
I'm gonna get you out of here!
Like a moth to the flame.
Are you in or are you out?
It's you who's out, Gobby. Out of your mind.
No one says no to me!
M.J., can you stop goofing around?
Aunt May. I'm sorry I'm late.
Work was murder. I picked up a fruitcake.
Why Thank you, Mr. Osborn. We're so glad you could come.
Who is this lovely young lady?
MJ, I'd like you to meet my father. Norman Osborn
Dad, this is Mary Jane Watson.
How do you do? I've been looking forward to meeting you.
He'd better remember that cranberry sauce.
Oh, that's weird. I didn't know he was here.
Bit of a slob, isn't he?
Sorry I'm late. It's a jungle out there.
Had to beat an old lady with a stick to get these cranberries.
Thank you. Now then, everybody sit down...
Oh..yeah..I stepped off a curb and got clipped by one of those bike messengers.
I'll get the first-aid kit. Then we'll say grace.
This is the boys' first Thanksgiving in this apartment, and we are going do things properly.
How did you say that happened?
If you'll excuse me, I've got to be going.
Something has come to my attention.
I'm fine, just fine. Thank you, Mrs. Parker. Everyone.
What are you doing? I planned this whole thing so you could meet M.J, and now you have to leave?
This girl is important to me.
Do you think a woman like that is sniffing around because she likes your personality?
They're all beautiful, until they're snarling after your trust fund like a pack of ravening wolves.
A word to the not so wise about your little girlfriend,
Do what you need to with her, then broom her fast.
Thanks for sticking up for me, Harry.
That creep is my father! If I'm lucky, I'll become half of what he is
so just keep your mouth shut about stuff you don't understand!
But Parker, we can destroy him.
Instruct him in the matters of loss and pain.
Make him suffer. Make him wish he were dead.
The cunning warrior attacks neither body nor mind.
Give us this day our daily bread, and forgive us our trespasses...
...as we forgive those who trespass against us.
Lead us not into temptation, but deliver us...
Aunt May. Is she gonna be okay? What happened?
How are you? You okay about the other night?
Yeah, I'm fine. I just felt bad about leaving Aunt May.
At least I think I am.
It's not the time to talk about it.
Would I know his name, this guy?
You'll think I'm a little girl with a crush.
He's saved my life twice, and I've never even seen his face.
No, I understand. He is extremely cool.
But do you think it's true, all the terrible things they say?
Not Spider-Man, not a chance in the world.
I know him a little bit.
I'm sort of his unofficial photographer.
He asked me what I thought about you.
I said, "The great thing about M.J...
The truth is, you don't know what you feel...
...except you know what kind of man you want to be.
You were right about M.J. You're right about everything.
And how does he feel about her?
He's loved her since the 4th grade.
He pretends like he doesn't, but there's no one Peter cares for more.
I haven't always been there for you, have I?
You're busy. You're an important man. I understand.
I've lost sight of that somewhere. But Im gona make it up to you.
I'm going to rectify certain inequities.
I don't like to leave you here.
Can I do anything for you?
College, a job, all this time with me. You're not Superman, you know.
Haven't seen one of those on your face since Mary Jane was here.
You were supposed to be asleep.
You know, you were about 6 years old when M.J.'s family moved in next door.
When she got out of the car, and you saw her for the first time...
...you grabbed me and said, "Aunt May, Aunt May, is that an angel?"
Well, Harry's in love with her.
Well, isn't that up to her?
She doesn't really know who I am.
You're so mysterious all the time.
Tell me, would it be so dangerous...
...to let Mary Jane know how much you care?
Hi. Sing your song at the beep.
Well, I'm just calling to check up on you. Will you call me when you get in?
Don't go up any dark alleys.
Can Spider-Man come out to play?
The itsy-bitsy spider Went up the water spoutDown came the goblin And took the spider out
Spider-Man! This is why only fools are heroes.Because you never know......when some lunatic will come along with a sadistic choice:
Let die the woman you love...
...and see how a hero is rewarded.
We are who we choose to be.Now, choose!
We're gonna bring the barge right under you.
Listen. I need you to climb down.
M.J., you can do it. You have to.
Hold on tight and go quickly.
I can't. I can't do it.
Come on up here joker! I got a lil something for you!
We ought to kick your freakin ass!
Leave Spider-Man alone! You gotta pick on a guy trying to save a bunch of kids?
I got something for yo ass! You mess with Spidey, you mess with New York!
You mess with one of us, you mess with all of us!
Misery, misery, misery. That's what you've chosen.

I offered you friendship......and you spat in my face.You've spun your last web, Spider-Man.Had you not been so selfish, your little girlfriend's death......would have been quick and painless.But now that you've really pissed me off......I'm gonna finish her nice and slow..M.J. and I...
...we're gonna have a hell of a time.
You killed those people on that balcony.
The Goblin killed! I had nothing to do with it!
Don't let him take me again.
You tried to kill Aunt May. You tried to kill Mary Jane.
I tried to stop it. But I couldn't stop it.
...it was you I could count on.
You, Peter Parker, would save me, and so you have.
Believe in me as I believed in you.
I've been like a father to you.
Be a son to me now.
